choices: Start Year 1 - The Philosophers Stone
Fast forwad - Start Year 2 - The Chamber of Secrets
Fast forward - Start Year 3 - The Prizoner of Azkaban
Fast forward - Start Year 4 - The Goblet of Fire
Fast Forward - Years 5, 6 and 7
1.content: Your mind is still struggling to accept the news it has taken in over the past week... Excitement floods your body, but still that voice in the front of your head keeps saying "this cannot be real... This has to be a dream Harry!"... Your arm hurts from pinching it repeatedly to ensure that this isn't actually a dream... But despite the fact that it has all seemed so surreal, here you are sitting on the train known at the "Hogwarts Express", heading to school to start your very first year of wizard schooling...
1.title: You're a Wizard Harry

choices: Remain silent... You are not really sure what you think of her just yet...
Ditch the bitch, she humiliated your new friend Ron!!
11.content:
The train rolls along and you can't help but to feel somewhat alone on this journey... I mean, Hagrid told you everything and helped you to buy all your things for school, but other than him you really don't have any friends... Or enemies for that matter. You never thought you would miss Dudley's company, but right now a friend or an enemy would be better than nothing! As this thought crossed your mind, the compartment door slid open to reveal a grubby looking red headed boy.

"Hey, do you mind if i join you? All the other compartments are full" He said.

"Not at all!" You reply, happy to finally have some company, and hopefully a new friend.

The red headed boy sat down opposite you and introduced himself as Ron Weasley.

"I'm Harry... Harry Potter" You replied.

His eyes grew wide at the sound of your name. Hagrid wasn't lying when he said that there wasn't a witch or wizard alive who didn't know who you were! He sat in stunned silence, as if he wasn't quite sure of what to say. Then he blurted out what must have been the first thing on his mind...

"So do you have the... The.... The scar??" He said, and blushed instantly.

You grinned and pulled back your fringe, revealing the lightning bolt scar upon your forehead. He smiled back and said it was wicked. It was then that you knew you had made your first friend in the wizarding while aside of Hagrid. Suddenly, the door slid open and a girl poked her head inside your compartment.

"Excuse me, have either of you seen a toad? A boy named Neville has lost one" She asked you both in a very snotty and arogant kind of way.

This girl seemed to breathe confidence as you both looked up at her dumbfounded, shaking your haids no. She noticed that Ron has his wand out and was performing magic, and a sly smile crossed her smug face.

"Oh, doing magic are you? Go on then, let's see it" She said.

Once again, Ron's face flushed a red that was a similar shade to his hair as he cleared his throat and lifted his wand... Needless to say, his spell was unsuccessful.

"Well, that wasn't very good now was it... I have tried different spells that actually work... Watch this!" She said, as she pointed her wand at your broken glasses. "Occulus Reparo"...

In an instant the sticky tape that held your glasses together flew off and your glasses were fixed. Suprised at the spell, you look up at this girl.

"I know you! You're Harry Potter", she said excitedly, after finally recognising who you were.

"I am Hermoine Granger" She said...

How do you react...
11.title: Start Year 1 - The Philosophers Stone

choices: To the sorting ceremony
111.content:
"Urmm.... Nice to meet you?" You say, a little startled at her.

"And i am Ron Weasley" Ron blurted out.

"Please to meet you both. By the way, you had best be changing into your robes, we are almost at Hogwarts" Hermoine said.

And with a flick of brown hair, Hermoine vanishes from sight and you are left sitting there with Ron gobsmacked.

“That was quite… Odd” You say to Ron.

“Yeah, what a know it all!” Ron says, clearly embarrassed at been shown up by a girl in front of somebody as famous as you. “Although she probably is right about getting dressed into our robes, I think we are nearly there.”

With this said, you and Ron changed into your school robes and not long afterwards, the train came to a halt at Hogsmeade station. One small boat ride later and you and Ron now find yourselves walking into the great hall surrounded by all the other students of Hogwarts, approaching an old and dirty hat sitting on a stool…
111.title: Remain silent... You are not really sure what y...

choices: The Sorting Hat
1111.content:
As the breathtaking castle door swung open, you immediately noticed a tall, black-haired witch with in emerald-green robes standing there. She appeared to have quite a menacing look about her as she addressed you and the rest of the students standing you;

"Welcome to Hogwarts, I am Professor McGonagall, the start-of-term banquet will begin shortly, but before you take your seats in the Great Hall, you will be sorted into your houses. The Sorting is a very important ceremony because, while you are here, your house will be something like your family within Hogwarts. You will have classes with the rest of your house, sleep in your house dormitory and spend free time in your house common room.

The four houses are called Gryffindor, Hufflepuff, Ravenclaw and Slytherin. Each house has it's own noble history and each has produced outstanding witches and wizards. While you are at Hogwarts, your triumphs will earn your house points, while any rule-breaking will lose house points. At the end of the year, the house with the most points is awarded the House Cup, a great honour. I hope each of you will be a credit to whichever house becomes yours. Now form a line."

As you walk into the Great Hall you see the extremely large and long room was lit by thousands and thousands of candles which were floating in mid-air over four long tables, where the rest of the year groups were sitting. At the top of the hall sat the teachers at another long tables, which was where Professor McGonagall was leading the queue of yourself and the other first year students.

As the hundreds of eyes of other students at you, you get quite nervous and decide to stare at the roof which strangely looked just like the night sky, then you overheard a whisper which no doubt came from Hermione telling other students that the ceiling is bewitched to look like the sky outside.
1111.title: To the sorting ceremony

choices: Gryffindor
Slytherin
11111.content:
Next came the sorting hat which was explained as a talking hat which would be placed upon the first year pupils heads, which would then read the persons mind and then shout out the house in which the student is to be placed in.

The room fell to silence as the sorting hat began and different students names were called out and placed in their house,

"Justin-Finch Fletchley" "HUFFLEPUFF!"
"Terry Boot" "RAVENCLAW!"
"Hermione Granger" "GRYFFINDOR!"
"Draco Malfoy" "SLYTHERIN!"
"Ronald Weasley" "GRYFFINDOR!"
"Susan Bones" "HUFFLEPUFF!"
"Harry Potter". . .

Your nerve were becoming almost overwhelming and you could swear you felt the heat in the room rise a few degrees, you don't have almost the faintest idea as to which house you would prefer to be placed in, you knew each house had their own strengths and could each benefit you greatly in different achievements. As the sorting hat is place on top of your head, you take a deep breath. . . still holding your breath . . . the sorting hat is taking more time than anyone else to decide . . . it has finally come to a decision . . .

You have been placed in . . .
11111.title: The Sorting Hat

choices: Gryffindor
Ravenclaw or Hufflepuff
111111.content: There are more than just 2 houses at Hogwarts you know.
111111.title: Hold It!

choices: Sleep in socks.
Sleep barefoot.
1111111.content: The Sorting Hat Harry in Gryffindor. Now moving to the time when they came to the apartment Gryffindor. They all went to sleep after a busy day and Harry changed into nightwear.
1111111.title: Gryffindor

choices: "Yes Goddess"
"Let us go!"
11111112.content:
Harry could not sleep that night. So much of his life was turned upside down from the events of the last few days. Magic, Hogwarts, Muggles, Wizards, it was just so much to take in. He vowed to make the most of this new life which he was given. "At this point, anything's better than the Dursleys."

Harry glanced at his timetable for the day. There was Transfiguration with professor Mcgonagall, Potions with Professor Snape and Quidditch with with professor Hooch. "Come on Harry. You can do this. One step at a time."

Things did not start smoothly. By the time Harry and Ron had found the Transfiguration classroom, they were already 20 minutes late. Hermoine rolled her eyes as they stumbled into the class. The late students felt immense relief as Professor Mcgonagall was nowhere in sight.

Ron let out a massive sigh. "Amazing. Can you imagine the look on Mcgonagall's face if we were late?" To their dismay, a house cat which was sitting on the front desk leaped off and it was the professor which completed the jump, strolling up to Ron and Harry immediately after.

Ron was in awe. "That was bloody brilliant!"
"Why thank you for that assessment Mr. Weasley" was her response. "Unfortunately for you I do not take kindly to such tardiness in my class. You will have to be disciplined."
Harry and Ron looked at each other worriedly as the professor pulled out her wand and pointed it towards the late-comers . "Reducio!"

The next thing the boys knew was that they were looking up at the humongous professor, and everything else for that matter.
"Yes boys, I've shrunk you down. Now come with me." The professor picked the boys up by their collars and marched out of the classroom. Hermoine was overwhelmed with disgust by professor Mcgonagall's method of punishment. Malfoy was filled with glee.

"Professor. Where are you taking us?"
"Quiet Mr Weasley."
"Hold a moment. That's the Slytherin common room!"
"I said to be silent Mr. Weasely. 20 points from Gryffindor."

The professor dropped the boys to the floor. "For the next hour or so, you will be at the mercy of these senior girls. Maybe this experience will teach you to be on time."
"But professor!"
The professor was already gone.

Harry and Ron looked at each other in panic. They did not want to imagine being at the mercy of senior Slytherin girls for an hour.
As they turned around, Ron's eyes rolled back and he fainted.

"Well well well Zelia, looks like Professor Mcgonagall dragged two more Gryffindor newbies for us to torture."
Harry gulped.
"Seems about right Lucinda. Bring the fainted one to me. He can suffer in my shoe while you can have that one cowering next to him all to yourself."
The towering student Lucinda marched toward Harry. The poor young wizard was frozen in place as if hypnotized from the immense size and beauty of the young dark-haired woman approaching him. She gracefully walked toward the two helpless tiny boys on the carpet and picked them up in her palms with ease. She placed Harry down on the table but gave Ron to Zelia.
"Here he is Zelia. Enjoy."
Harry could only watch as it unfolded. Zelia grabbed Ron violently, waking him up. "Ohh you're up are you?" She drew pleasure in the panicked look on Ron's face. "Not for long." Zelia hung Ron from her two fingers while undoing her shoe. Without hesitation she dropped Ron into her shoe and placed it on the ground.
Ron looked at Harry defeated and yelled desperately.
"Harry!"
"Ron! No!"
Zelia inserted her socked foot into the shoe before stomping down on it, after which Ron's cries could no longer be heard. She then crossed her legs without a care and went back to what she was doing.

"You monster!", yelled Harry as tears began to well up in his eyes. Chills went up his spine as he heard Lucinda's sadistic voice behind him. "You haven't seen anything yet tiny."
As Harry turned around, Lucinda pressed down on him with her finger, pinning him to the table. "Well now. Are you who I think you are? That scar on your head." Lucinda's face beamed with satisfaction, as if she had just figured something out. "So you're my prize. The legendary Harry Potter himself."

Harry could say nothing. Lucinda's piercing violet eyes had him frozen with fear.
"Well this just got just a tiny bit more interesting." she said sarcastically. "Tell you what Potter. For the next hour or so I'll be calling you 'slave' and you'll call be 'Goddess'. You'll do everything I tell you and in return I won't kill you underneath my foot. Is that clear?"
Harry did not manage a response while Lucinda removed her green Slytherin socks and rested her huge feet atop the table right in front of Harry.
"It better be. Now lick my feet clean slave."
11111112.title: Sleep barefoot.

choices: "I'm going back to the dorm Ron. I need some rest."
"See you at potions class Ron."
111111121.content:
Any courage that Harry was building up evaporated in an instant in the presence of the power of Lucinda's feet. He was subdued and humbled in his meek reply.

"Yes goddess."

"Look at that. You're completely broken at my feet slave. So much for the legendary Harry Potter."
Harry dared not speak further. He gave all his attention to licking Lucinda's feet until they were spotless in hopes that she would be merciful and let him live. After a while, Harry's voice could be heard weakly trying to speak.
"Did you say something slave?"
Harry's words were slightly more audible the second time. "I can't reach the top of your sole."
"Who are you speaking to slave?"
Harry let out a defeated sigh. "I can't reach the top of your sole Goddess Lucinda."
Lucinda grinned. "I might have an idea about that."

Lucinda removed her feet from the table. As her foot smell relinquished, Harry dropped to his knees in a moment of relief. Such relief was fleeting as the goddess lifted Harry with two fingers before dropping him to the carpet just below her chair. She spoke no further words before planting the top of her sole onto Harry's powerless body.
"Maybe this will teach you not to complain when I give orders slave." She increased the pressure of her foot slightly until Harry began screaming in pain. "What was that slave? Speak up a bit." She increased the pressure again and again, Harry screamed in agony.

Zelia could not hide her amusement. She smiled and pressed down hard into her shoe as well. Ron's screams were muffled, but no less intense. "These first year Gryffindors need to be taught their place from the start."

After what seemed like an eternity of relentless smothering, Lucinda dragged Harry across the mat under her foot before lifting off from his battered body. As Harry forced his eyes open, he was met again with Lucinda's violet gaze, and a massive grin on her face.
"Looks like all that torture has gotten you excited slave."
"What?"
Zelia spoke up with a devious smile. "I thought felt something poking out in my shoe"

As Harry lifted his head, he was appalled to see that there was a huge bulge in his Gryffindor pants.

Despite her best efforts, Lucinda couldn't hold in her laughter. "This is outragous! How old are you anyway slave. Twelve? Eleven? Ten? Do you even know what that thing does?"
Harry shook his head. He had no idea.
Lucinda and Zelia exchanged glances. It's as if their two minds became one for a moment. Lucinda's voice soon spoke up. "Tell you what slaves. Whichever one of you creams first, is going to die first!"
Zelia was bewildered at Lucinda's comment on killing the students. As far as she knew, they were to torture them, but to take their lives would be a horrible and unforgivable act. She concluded to herself that Lucinda was bluffing and decided to play along. As her shoe came off, Ron's almost flattened body fell to the floor.

He looked at Harry to inspect the condition of his friend. "Harry! What are they going to do to us?!"
Harry shook his head in confusion.

Before long, Lucinda's bare sole pressed against Harry once more. His head poked out between her toes and she began to caress his body underfoot with backward and forward movements. Zelia placed her socked foot onto the lower half of Ron's body and began moving her socks back and forth as well. Ron screamed with every movement of Zelia's foot to the point where both the girls became more than annoyed. Zelia placed her other foot down onto Ron's head to shut him up.
Mere seconds had passed before Zelia could feel that she was almost finished with Ron.
Lucinda looked down at Harry. The young Gryffindor was completely at her mercy and would soon cream under her foot, resulting in his immediate death.

"Ohhh looks like we're done here Lucy" said Zelia with a smile. Ron's pants were stained and moist as he screamed in pain.
Lucy responded. "Looks like you're the first to go foot pet."
Immediately afterwards, Harry screamed out and Lucinda felt the bottom of her sole dampen. From below her foot, Harry could see Lucinda smile with satisfaction. "I think it's a double execution now Zelia."

As both girls hovered their feet over their hopeless victims, the door swung open and professor Mcgonagall marched inside. Both girls had differing expressions on their face as they hurried to retract their feet from above the tiny students. The professor approached and lifted them both by their collars as she inspected their conditions. As she noticed the moisture on both the boys' pants, she glanced over to the girls with urgency and proceeded to speak. "Girls. It seems that you have done marvelous work with these boys while I was gone. 20 points to Slytherin." The two 'goddesses' looked at each other with glee and proceeded to celebrate with a high five followed by a hug.

As the professor took the boys outside, she focused her wand on them and uttered a spell. "Engorgio."
The boys were returned to their full respective sizes.
"I hope in the past half an hour, the two of you learned to never be late in my class."
"But professor. I thought that we were meant to be punished for an hour."
"Yes but I felt sorry for you Mr. Potter. Do not make me regret it."
The two boys nodded in an instant.
Professor Mcgonagall concluded. "Now then. I assume that you both have more classes today. I suggest that you wash yourselves off and get ready. You wouldn't want what happened with me to be repeated with the other professors now would you." The two boys shook their heads in unison.

Before the friends departed, Ron placed his hand on Harry's shoulder.
"Where are you headed now Harry."
Harry Turned to face his friend.
111111121.title: "Yes Goddess"

1111111211.content:
Barely able to stand up, Harry stumbled up the moving staircase to the Gryffindor common room entrance. As he approached the door, the 'Fat Lady' portrait eyed him with a stern face. "Password?" she said firmly.

"Uhhh. Caput Draconis" With much effort, Harry managed to recall the password to his own common room. The Fat Lady nodded with approval and let the ragged boy through. Harry struggled up the stairs to the boys dormitory. The eventual sight of his bed filled him with relief as he inched closer. He paid no heed to the sound of approaching footsteps behind him as he thought it would be just another Gryffindor student. That was until he heard a familiar sadistic voice which made his skin crawl.
"Hello slave. Miss me?" The violet eyes of Harry's goddess latched themselves onto him and pierced fiercely into his soul. "Such a naughty boy. Skipping classes are we?" Harry felt his heart begin to pound like never before. Could Lucinda be even more menacing now than when he was shrunken? She was a fully grown woman, being a senior, much taller than Harry was and Harry felt as trapped now as when he was underneath her sole. As she stepped closer to him, Harry retreated backwards at the same time as if he was already hypnotized by her.

He muttered in a weak and fearful voice. "How did you get in?"
"Oh slave. I heard you as you came in. Caput Draconis. Typically bad Gryffindor password. I could have probably guessed it myself."
"I'd leave if I were you. A prefect might come in here any second."
"Oh slave. I'm so scared. Not that it's possible now that the Fat Lady is unlikely to wake up for a while. Let's just say not even she could resist my...charms. How unwise of you to come here all alone Potter, after what happened earlier."
Harry dropped his head in shame.
"You should have stayed with your friends. Now, you'll kneel."

Harry dropped to his knees.
Lucinda lifted the bottom of her shoes. "Lick my shoes slave."
Harry bent his head down to below her shoe level, completely at her mercy. He looked up at the sole which was covered in dust and dirt. Unable to muster any free will, he commenced licking the shoe and didn't top until the sole was spotless from top to bottom.

"Not bad slave." Lucinda bent down gracefully to Harry's level and hooked her index finger below his chin, before lifting him to his feet as she rose. She grinned at Harry. "Ugh. You need a bath slave. You smell like someone stepped all over you." Her palm then pressed against Harry's chest as she walked toward him, causing him to retreat backwards again until he fumbled onto his bed behind. Before he could make any further movements, Lucinda placed herself on top of the helpless boy, trapping him between her thighs. "Such a week slave you are. And you thought you would last here in Hogwarts? Have friends? Be happy?" Lucinda smirked. "Those chances seem slim now don't they slave?"

Without warning, Lucinda moved up to kneel over Harry's face and sat down on him with her full weight. Harry's desperate attempts at escaping from under her were futile as his head was smothered by the force between the goddess's thighs. His violent clawing at Lucinda's body managed to bring a grin to her face as she effortlessly held the boy's arms in place and tilted her head in satisfaction while grinding her hips over his increasingly pale head. Before long, she felt that the boy was no longer resisting. As she released her grip, his arms dropped down to the sides, lifeless.

Harry opened his eyes to astonishment. He lay motionless in a grassy forest among tall trees at sunset. Unable to move his arms and legs, he tilted his head to the side where a bloody demon cursed his vision. The creature forced it's dying eyes up to Harry and whispered. "Harryyyy...P...Potterrrr is dead. Finally." The beast attempted to laugh, but failed, instead releasing an excruciating moan until it expired.

Harry's vision was filled with blinding white until he opened his eyes again to see Lucinda on top of him.

"You know slave. Lord Voldemort gave me until the end of this year to kill you. How impressive of me to complete my task on your first day." she laughed.
Harry again tried to resist but Lucinda grabbed him by the throat and pushed him down into the mattress, with her wand at the ready in the other hand. Tears rushed down Harry's face as his goddess pointed the wand down directly over his head. She then whispered a spell.

"Sectumsempra."

Harry felt the insides of his body implode as if slashed by an invisible sword. He tried to scream but choked on his own blood. Blood which had begun to flow from his ears, nose, mouth and other parts of his body, soaking the bed sheets in red. Lucinda placed her hands on her hips in satisfaction. She had carried out the dark Lord's plan. She rolled the suffering boy off the bed causing him to brutally fall on his back before standing over him one last time. All Harry could manage was to force his eyes up at her as a blood pool formed all around.

"Goodbye Harry. Sleep well." In a swift motion, Harry's mutilated head was crushed under Lucinda's shoe, ending his life.

With Harry Potter eradicated with no effort at all, Lord Voldemort enslaved all the Wizarding World and proved to be the most powerful dark wizard in history.
1111111211.title: "I'm going back to the dorm Ron. I need...

choices: Chapter 2 - Gryffindor vs Slytherin
1111111212.content:
Professor Snape continued. "I can teach you how to bewitch the mind and ensnare the senses. I can tell you how to bottle fame, brew glory and...". It was at this moment that Harry slept away until being awakened by Hermione's shoulder tapping against him.

"Mr. Potter. Our newest.......................................................................... ................................................................................ ......celebrity."

That was about the last thing Harry could remember from potions class. The rest was a foggy mix between asphodel and bezoar. Harry pushed himself up the changing staircase towards his dormitory after the class. Upon entering, he was greeted with Hermione with a concerned look on her face.

"Harry. Are you alright?"
"I think I'll be okay Hermione. It's nothing."
"You look terrible Harry. What has you in this state? What was Professor Mcgonagall's punishment this morning."

"I...wish I could tell you Hermione. I just can't! Whenever I try to speak about it, the words seem to come out as sort of... mush!"
"Hmmm. It sounds like some kind of speech bewitchment charm. I'll see what I can find in the library. For now Harry," she eyes his tattered body up and down. "Get some rest."

As Harry lay down, the presence of his fellow students around the dormitory and common room gave him a sense of safety and comfort. He closed his eyes determined to put this horrible first day so far behind him. Within seconds, he was in a deep and peaceful sleep.

End of Chapter 1
1111111212.title: "See you at potions class Ron."

111111122.content:
A sudden stream of courage coursed through Harry's body, bolting him to his feet. "Let us go!"

Lucinda placed her finger on her bottom lip and raised an eyebrow, as if slightly impressed by Harry's courage. A look which faded in the blink of an eye.

"Look at you. In what universe could you possibly stand a chance in this situation slave?" Harry was not phased by her words.

He heroically pulled out his wand and pointed it at Lucinda.

"Such fire. Finally you're starting live up to your name as 'The Boy Who Lived'. Let's see you in action then. Show me what you can do. A puny little first year, facing his goddess to win his freedom. I'll let you have the first move." Lucinda spoke tauntingly at her slave.

Harry's body filled with determination and courage and he was determined to make the most of this chance. Unfortunately for him, he was unfamiliar with any defensive or offensive spells, and his shoulders slumped in disappointment.

"Pathetic slave." Lucinda chuckled. "I gave you a chance." Without hesitation, Lucinda placed her long, powerful fingers in front of Harry and with a relentless bash, she flicked him off the table and onto the carpet. Lucinda rose from her chair and marched over to Harry with menacing authority. "I told you to do as I said bug. Perhaps you need to be taught a lesson. Zelia, do us a favor and kill your little foot pet."
Harry's eyes swelled in shock at the revelation that Ron was still alive.

He was surprised as Zelia seemed reluctant. "But Lucy, we were just supposed to torture them for an hour. No one was supposed to die!"

Lucinda knelt down on one knee in front of Harry and gave him wry smile. She subtly turned back and pointed her wand at her friend and whispered "Imperio".
She then rose to her feet and said softly "You will kill him now Zelia."

Zelia didn't hesitate. She pulled off her shoe and flipped it over, dropping Ron to the ground. Harry watched with tears flowing down his face. There was nothing he could do. Zelia raised her socked foot above Ron, casting a deathly shadow over him. Ron could utter nothing before the humongous foot smashed down onto him and twisted him into the carpet. By the time she was finished. Ron was nothing but a red stain on her sock and the carpet. The boy's uniform was soaked in his crimson red blood.

Harry lay on the carpet traumatized and unable to move.
Lucinda laughed before turning back to harry and pinning him down under her bare foot. "Things could have been different if you had just listened Potter. Oh, never mind that. You never stood a chance Now, it's your turn."

Harry was motionless as the shadow of Lucinda's bare sole covered him. He would have closed his eyes if he wasn't frozen and traumatized.
Lucinda's foot smashed down quickly onto Harry's miniscule body,. He felt all of is bones crush at once but what came next was not what he expected. He was lying down in a grassy forest.
Harry was unable to move his body but as he turned his head, he was possessed with fear. A bloody demon lay next to him, dying. As the creature gave it's final breath, it uttered softly "You are mine now boy. Harry Potter is finally dead." As the beast lost it's life, Harry's vision was clouded with white until the next thing he saw was Lucinda raising her foot.

"Still alive aren't you slave?" Lucinda knelt down on one knee, smiling at Harry as she began to whisper.

"Between you and me slave. I am a servant of Lord Voldemort. He gave me until the end of this year to kill you. How impressive of me to complete my task on your first day." She giggled with delight.

"Goodbye Potter. Sleep well." She ended Harry with a swift stomp, before grinding his remains into the carpet.

In the end, with Harry Potter eradicated with no effort at all, Lord Voldemort enslaved all the Wizarding World an proved to be he most powerful dark wizard in history.
111111122.title: "Let us go!"

choices: The Next Day
111112.content:
"SLYTHERIN!" the sorting hat cries out.

Your heart almost drops as you look down towards the Slytherin table who appear to be quite a menacing bunch, you also noticed that a lot of students are whispering and some gasping as you slowly walk down towards your new house who would be like your new family, you can't help but think back to the Dursley's.

There is only one seat left at the table and it just so happens to be next to another Slytherin boy in 1st year who introduces himself to you as Draco Malfoy and also seems to be the only one in the entire hall who is not shocked at your name or about who you are.

After a short speech from Dumbledore, the feast begins which is more than enough to take your mind of things, this helps you begin to talk to the people sat around you. Although at the beginning, Draco Malfoy seemed to be somewhat of a shady character, you are actually chatting to him and seems actually funny and quite friendly. You also meet two other large boys who look like they seem to be tagging along with Draco, their names are Crabbe and Goyle, although they don't speak overly much and seem to be more brawn than brains, you feel you will be able to get along with them just fine. To the right of you at the opposite side of the table there is a girl who you have noticed hasn't really spoke much since you sat down, you ask her name and she tells you it's Pansy Parkinson, you, Draco and her get talking to each other and you can feel a friendship starting between all of you's.

At that moment you decide you are more than happy to become one of the Snake's in the Slytherin House. Shortly after dessert (which you barely didn't have room for until you seen the delicious chocolate pumpkin balls filled with caramel sauce) you are escorted by the Slytherin prefects to the dungeons in the castle walls where the entrance to the common room is located behind a stone wall. As you are so tired after a long breathtaking day, You immediately go to the 1st year boys dormitory with Draco, Crabbe and Goyle. You each decide on a bed and fall asleep shortly after jumping into it.
111112.title: Slytherin Table

choices: Defence Against the Dark Arts
Meet Ron Weasley and Hermione Granger in the corridors
1111121.content:
As you wake up the next day, you have a bit of time before going down to breakfast where you will receive you new timetables for the different classes throughout the day. You decide to take a look around with Draco and Pansy who have already started explaining some of the different things within the common room, this tells you that they had been planning on getting into Slytherin no matter what.

An Irish Gryffindor boy named Seamus Finnagan who is sitting at the other side of the classroom tries so hard that he manages to blow his feather up rather than levitate it, as the whole class laughs at his misfortune (More so the Slytherins) your eyes meet Pansy Parkinson's who you had noticed had been slightly glancing at you throughout the previous day and the entire class. 14.content:
Leaving Number 4 Privet Drive doesn't happen often to young Harry Potter. But when and if it does, he is never able to forget it. Even among being rescued from an abandoned isle by an umbrella-wielding giant, to manning a flying getaway car while under house arrest, and all the way to blowing up an aunt as a means to ride a triple-decker London bus to uncharted magical territory, this year, right on the cusp of Harry's fourteenth birthday, had to be the strangest occurrence yet: Being emancipated from the prison that is the Dursleys by four unlikely, and equally entranced, Wizards, all equipped with matching fiery hair, which were perhaps reflections for their blazing spirits as well. One reunion, group hug, overly-stamped letter, victimized cousin, and chimney channel of transportation later, Harry Potter finds himself back at the Weaseley's, his spontaneous rescuers, along with one more unexpected, but certainly gratifying, guest: Hermione.

"Harry..are you okay?" Speaking of whom, it was the wonderful, enchanting, but ironically Muggle girl that expressed the concern directed towards Harry.

Harry's head jolted upright from his downwards gaze, clearly too lost in his own thought. His eyes met that of Hermione's, whose brown splash of auburn on white, circumscribed by a contrasting palette of her long eyelashes, had the most inviting aura about them, as if they were begging Harry to approach with closer intensity. However, appearing to be lost in an entirely different thought regarding that of the beautiful Hermione, the question is beckoned again: "Harry! Are you okay?"

"Oh," the word stumbled out as Harry regained his composure from the infatuating spell that Hermione's body affixes, "Yeah, I'm fine."

Hermione's raises an eyebrow in suspicion, raising an issue not even Harry was aware of yet: "Well, you were just staring so intently at my feet for some reason," Hermione stated amidst an innocent laugh, clearing thinking nothing of this gesture upon her feet. Before returning back to the boardgame with Ginny that Harry's attention diverted her from, Hermione looked at Harry for a response.

For a second, Harry just stared back, mouth slightly ajar, bemused in his expression. Had he really been recalling all the past events of the last 12 hours to the visual cue of Hermione's feet? Contemplating for a second without directly meeting Hermione's rising curiosity displayed in her eyes, Harry, fueled by mere curiosity, without an adherence to the extra suspicion it might manifest in Hermione, lowered his eyes to glimpse at Hermione's feet again, in some sort of attempt to find out why he was staring; the reason, upon second evaluation, was quite obvious:

Hermione's feet, positioned one on top of the other, were an ivory colour, one that Harry only saw a fleeting gaze of, considering that Hermione positioned her sitting self in such that she faced the opposite direction of Harry, legs squatted in a fashion that made it so her soles stared directly in Harry's direction, with her toes only peeking through to Harry's eyes if, by some fortune, Hermione had the good intention to scrunch her toes, permitting seductive peek. The peek consisted of ebony painted toenails, long enough to be very inviting, with a perfect curvature of the nail; this complimented brilliant the wrinkled, creamy soles of Hermione, from extra milky, snowwhite ball of her foot, to the lush sole, all the way down to the velvety heel, protruding in such a way that Harry had to use all his available willpower to not become gravitated by. Her ankles, unfortunately, were shrouded by jeans, so no critique could be made upon them--though, if Hermione's ankles were anything like her feet, the review would be lovingly. Harry wasn't that annoyed though; after all, after four years of Hogwarts customary dresscodes of long socks and leather heeled shoes, Hermione's bare feet more than gratified The Boy Who Lived.

This trance of euphoria for Hermione' s feet, however, only lasted but a second, as Harry teared his stare from Hermione's beautiful feet to that of Hermione's face, which one could argue is equally beautiful.

Finally addressing Hermione's concern about staring at her feet, Harry finally summoned up the meekly words of: "Oh, y'know...thinking," finishing off with a slightly half-grin that was met with Hermione's amazed smile and eyes. Ginny, however, from what little Harry was paying attention to her, looked annoyed.

This was the first time Hermione and Harry were in the same house, spending the night with each other, he surmised. Things could get...interesting.

144.content:
Nothing got interesting that night. Nor was it interesting the night after or the following nights to come. Harry did concede that going to the Quidditch World Cup, knowing someone summoned the Dark Mark, meeting Mad-Eye Moody, learning about the Three Unforgivable Curses, and expecting the return of the Dark Lord Voldemort might be interesting to a normal wizard, but to Harry, these things are expected at this point. What was interesting to Harry, at least ever since that one epiphany at the Burrow, was Hermione, and better yet, her feet.

Harry's anxiousness to even see Hermione's feet have even started manifesting in his actions, with Harry attempting, as best he could, to spend every waking available moment with Hermione, devising ill-conceived opportunities for her to take her shoes and socks off and reveal her gorgeous feet one more time to him. Suffice to say, the opportunity had yet to present itself to Harry. All of this changed, however, with Hermione's discovery of the houseelves.

Hermione had taken kindly to these subservient creatures, and despite that the same could not be said for the houseelves unto her, a mutual bond was forming. So much so, that the houseelves had now begun bequeathing Hermione with socks, and like the courteous witch she was, Hermione was glad to oblige the elves by wearing the hand-woven leggings. Harry, due his resilience in sticking with Hermione, seized the opportunity.

"These are ridiculous!" Hermione gasped as she held the multi-patterned sock from its opening to the eyes of a derisive Harry. The sock bore at least eight different colors in a pattern of varying consistency; it started just as repeating stripes at the top, but gradually coalesced into an obtrusive checkerboard-like arrangement, and then back to pinstripes at the very bottom toe section. As if a satire upon real socks, these elf-made socks were woven with different materials, some rough, some soft--others weren't even for clothes, like plastic. According to Harry, dubbing these garments as socks would pose an insult to all the other socks in existence. Hermione couldn't help but laugh in agreement.

"Well, c'mon," Harry urged, clear with his intent in mind to see Hermione's feet, "You have to put them on."

Taking the urging with genuineness, Hermione agreed with a heavy sigh.

The two were in the Gryffindor Commons, Hermione sitting on the couch facing the fireplace, while Harry lay on the floor, leaning against the sofa, his arm resting upon the cushion, head turned to face Hermione's overly terrified look. Hermione's shoes were already kicked, placed neatly on the Commons' floor, next to the sofa where Harry and Hermione were on. With the shoes already off, Harry knew what had to come next, and he was egging the opportunity at every chance.

"Here," Harry began to offer, laughing at Hermione's hesitance, "You seem scared. Let me at least help?"

Harry slowly placed his hands on Hermione's socked ankles, fingers pointed towards the cusp of the customary long, ivory stockings of the Hogwarts Witches, which was made all the easier because Hermione, while laying back on the couch, stretched her legs, and by extension, her feet upright in front of her, giving Harry plenty of vantage from his ground position to place his hands lovingly on Hermione's beautiful, stockinged feet. Then, as if seeking the continued approval, Harry looked upwards to see Hermione's expression, of which was still buried in her hands, the elf sock dangled from the fingers. Hermione withdrew her exasperated face from her palms and looked downwards to Harry's helpful demeanor, giving off a smile and a smile that Hermione gestured as "Thank you," but Harry took as, "Yes, you can touch my feet."

By the given permission, Harry inched his hands upwards to the cusp of Hermione's long black stockings, digging his fingers into the inside, with his fingertips feeling the silky, soft, and slightly cold legs of Hermione Granger. Aching with anticipation but not wanting to come off as overly anxious, Harry began removing, slowly, the socks from Hermione's legs, with his gaze focused sharply on the precarious task at hand, he felt Hermione's stare upon his neck. At long last, Harry had grappled the first sock from Hermione's foot and had let it drop upon his lap, as Harry, not since the Burrow, was able to fixate upon Hermione's foot.

It was glorious. This was the first time Harry had a proper peer upon the front of Hermione's foot, and it was heavenly; it was snowy and soft, smelled like a rose-flavored fragrance, felt creamy to the touch, as if Harry's fingers were thrust upon a pillow; the toenails were painted the same luster black as that from the Burrow, and Hermione's delicate toes, perfect in their complexion, stretched outright towards Harry's mouth, or so it at least seemed to Harry. Harry instinctively started rubbing the Hermione's sexy sole with his right thumb in circles as the fingers of his left were tracing the top of Hermione's foot, edging in no particular direction, just savoring the sensual touch of Hermione's amazing feet. Harry breathed in by impulse. He was, for this very moment, in heaven.

However, he was not in heaven. He was not alone. He was in the Gryffindor's Common Room, hands groping the intensely sexy foot of Hermione Granger, who was the subject of Harry's sexual infatuation. A fact, that Hermione might well have noticed.

152133.content:
As 'The Boy Who Lived', Harry found peace and quiet to be the hardest things to attain. Even in the library, he felt the pressure of eyes on his back as he studied. His adventures, over the years adding to the fascination. Some would say, his hunger for fame. Even the company of his best friends was sometimes a burden. Certainly one he couldn't share with them, or even fully explain, it was simply unique and his to solve.

He'd vaguely offered them half explanations, about Quidditch, flying Hedwig, visiting Hogsmeade, and left them to work out when and where he be.

So, it was that Harry found himself outside the chamber of secrets. Hissing a parseltongue command, he watched as the ornate metallic snakes withdrew and with an eerie silence opened wide to allow him entry. It brought back old memories, he couldn't imagine Ron would ever want to revisit this place or the memories of Lockhart's betrayal, or his sister's kidnapping.

It was Ron's half-repaired wand that he discovered, abandoned and forgotten. He wondered how often he'd wandered past it without noticing. The passage now cleared of the debris. Not certain why, he picked it up and tucked it into his jeans pocket. Walking deeper into the chamber. The ornate snake stone statues still as unnerving in the wand light. The half-rearing, gaping mouths still startling in the half light, and from the corner of his eye.

It was with a hint of shame that he snuck the notebook from it's hiding place. Concerned that the half-blood prince's book was possessed, enchanted, cursed, or just working some other magic on him. His experience with magical artefacts was deeply unlucky, and with Riddle's diary it felt like any precaution was justified. Whoever had made the additions was clearly a talented wizard... or as Hermione suggested a witch.

His own untidy handwriting covered the page. Carefully transcribed from the 'Advanced Book of Spells', chastened by his fight with Draco in the toilet, he wasn't going to make that mistake again. An impulse to keep his own copy private, and to not use any spell he hadn't used at least once in here. The writing was done quickly, and without any attempt at comprehension. Faster was better, as he wanted to limit his exposure to any harm the book might be inflicting.

Lumos

The glowing ball rose into the air brightening the entire room even the arched roof, crafted to look like interwoven snakes slithering over one another. Baleful emerald green eyes glowering down at him.

Dismissing the thoughts of the basilisk from his mind, he sat down on the coils of a marble serpent, and read. He knew the value of the potions advice, but could hardly build a stockpile down here without attracting undue attention. So he scanned through his notes for non-potion suggestions. He also wanted to avoid any combat or duelling magic.

Finding the part he'd reached, the highligher marks stopping where he'd left them. Distractedly, he recalled Mr. Weasley's reaction to seeing Harry use the yellow highligher pen on his notes. The muttering about muggle ingenuity. Harry promised to explain the 'magic' pen and also the 'thermos' spell he'd seen the muggles use on picnics.

Ensuring it wasn't marked 'for enemies', or involved bubbling cauldrons, Harry found a couple of interesting candidates for experimentation. Perhaps if benign, he'd sell them to Fred and George. There were times he wished he hadn't hidden the book. As Hermione observed rather too loudly, his handwriting was appalling, and he found himself wishing he could double check what he'd written.

Without knowing who the author was, Harry found it hard to resist the temptation it was his father... or maybe one of the other marauders. While the book was gone, he comforted himself by reassuring himself it wasn't destroyed.

Their limited knowledge of her was already that she viewed them as inferior, that she saw them as little more than animals.
